publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-728# Alasdair Morgan: General Medical Services Contracts-That the Parliament is concerned that the provisions made for contracting-out out-of-hours care from GPs to local NHS boards may be insufficiently funded to meet the unique challenges encountered in rural practices; believes that rural practices thus unable to opt out will have serious difficulty in recruiting new doctors, and considers that the Scottish Executive should re-examine the level of funding allocated to NHS boards providing these services in rural areas.

S2M-728# Alasdair Morgan: General Medical Services Contracts-That the Parliament is concerned that the provisions made for contracting-out out-of-hours care from GPs to local NHS boards may be insufficiently funded to meet the unique challenges encountered in rural practices; believes that rural practices thus unable to opt out will have serious difficulty in recruiting new doctors, and considers that the Scottish Executive should re-examine the level of funding allocated to NHS boards providing these services in rural areas. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Alex Neil*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Rosie Kane*, Campbell Martin*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Ms Sandra White*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Brian Adam*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr David Davidson*, David Mundell*, Murray Tosh*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Alex Fergusson*, John Scott*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Phil Gallie*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Miss Annabel Goldie*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) John Swinburne*
S2M-728# General Medical Services Contracts (lodged on 11 December 2003) Mary Scanlon*

S2M-728# Alasdair Morgan: General Medical Services Contracts-That the Parliament is concerned that the provisions made for contracting-out out-of-hours care from GPs to local NHS boards may be insufficiently funded to meet the unique challenges encountered in rural practices; believes that rural practices thus unable to opt out will have serious difficulty in recruiting new doctors, and considers that the Scottish Executive should re-examine the level of funding allocated to NHS boards providing these services in rural areas. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Campbell Martin, Ms Sandra White, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell, Murray Tosh, Alex Fergusson, John Scott, Mrs Nanette Milne, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Phil Gallie, Rob Gibson, Jim Mather, Miss Annabel Goldie, John Swinburne, Mary Scanlon, Dr Jean Turner*
